revised_title: Unfolding a Chaotic Bifurcation in Forced Pendulum Dynamics
tldr: The authors study the chaotic behavior of a forced pendulum and discover two symmetrically related chaotic attractors that merge and separate as the forcing amplitude and a constant bias are varied. They explain this phenomenon in terms of homoclinic structures and propose a codimension two bifurcation of chaotic attractors, which is closely related to the elementary cusp catastrophe.
